ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: We are running an Old Age Home provided residential accommodation for destitude persons above sixty years. Priority - Priority given for admission in Old Age Home to Destitude mentally ill / perkinsons patient / Algymer / Dementia. Good and Modern infrastructure is available for the rehabilitation of the persons of above mentioned types. Two Residential Centres with special schools for persons with disabilities above 18 years (only for M.R., C.P, Autism and M.D.)are being run smoothly with a total seat capacity of 60. The centres are 100% barrier-free and 24 hours water, electricity and vocational training facilities are available here. Community based Rehabilitation Proggrames for the disabled children specially for the Deafblind are being conducted. We have been organising Awareness and Training Programmes for empowerment of rural women and Self Help Groups as a part of Commuity Development. Being Nodal Agency under the National Trust, Govt. of India, we are functioning the responsibilities of State Nodal Agency Centre and as Regional Resource Training Centre of National Institute of Social Defence, Govt. of India. All the staff members, working within the purview of our organisation are registered by the Rehabilitation Council of India and National Institute of Social Defence, Govt. of India. Ten of these members are duly trained under the aforesaid two national institutes.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Adarsha Sangha has emerged to give a shape to all those welfare activities were initiated by the local youths; school student and other s motivated people of Dewanpasha village. Although this organisation initiative has been started on January 12th 1983 under the banner of the Adarsha Sangha, but it has got legal identity during the year 1999. The sangha was moulded with the inspirations of Swami Vivekananda for has dedicated services, love and social work for the fellow people, neighbours and the countryman. Considering above motivation, the initial support was receipt from a total number of 25 people and few females determined to do some social works for the needy and deprived people of the area. However, the initial services were restricted within the educational support, financial support, support of complete marriage of girls, construction of village roads, provide blood to the patients etc. later the effect of the dedicated service has encouraged the more people to join their hands with the Sangha. Institutions like Nehru Yuva Kendra (NYK) North Tripura District has also extended their support to utilize this motivation and service in and around the Dewanpasha village to mobilize youths in groups through the sangha. The reflection of the services of the extended by the sangha can also be measured with best Youth Awards for consecutive three years i.e. for the year 1999, 2000, 2001 and also District Level best Youth Club Award-2015, State Level best Youth Club Award 2015, our CEO Sri Anjan Bardhan also getting National Youth Award in the year 2004. Besides, awards as the Best District Youth Club of North Tripura District for the year 2002 has further encourages the members and volunteers to give their best for the development of the people. In the year 2004 the Sangha has start prayash project (Micro credit Program) in the year 2007 lunched grass root resource centre (GRC) project and in the year 2010 start community based fishery project under guidance of RGVN, Guwahati and TATA Social Trust, Mumbai. In the year 2015 the Sangha has start the 2 nos. sub centre for Child line Project in Jampui & Kanchanpur under guidance of Child Line India Foundation (CIF) under Ministry of woman and Child Development Govt. of India. Therefore, the supports and co operation received form this organization like NYKS, Tripura, RGVN, Guwahati, RMK, Delhi, NEDFi, Guwahati, SIDBI, Guwahati, TATA Social Welfare Trust, Mumbai, Tripura State Pollution Control Board, Childline India Foundation, Mumbai, Tripura State AIDS Control Society, Agartala, NVBDCP, Agartala, CMO, North, became our guiding factors to continue our services aiming towards target development.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: ASHABORI WELFARE SOCIETY is a non political, non profitable and secular organisation which was established on May 2002 and formally inaugurated by Swami Divyananda Maharaj, Secretary Ramakrishna Mission, Viveknagar, Agartala on 11th May 2002 at Mouchak Club premise, Agartala. The organization is registered under Society registration act 1860 and PWDs Act. 1995 registration No. 29 0f 2015 with an aim to support physically challenged persons. The organization started its journey as an Art and Painting institute for the blind persons. Though the aim of the organization was to teach art and painting to blind only, but feeling the psychological aspect, the facility was extended to other categories of disabled. From its Ashabori Welfare Society has been working for the betterment of the life of physically challenged persons by organizing art exhibition for blind persons, skill development program, medical camp, sports and cultural programs etc. With the aim to promote co-working ecosystem of both physically challenged and physically non challenged peoples, Ashabori welfare society has expand its area of interest to both physically challenged and physically non challenged people from last few years. This will not only improve the social position of physically challenged persons but also improve their livelihood. In this regard the organization already stared different programs like workshop, exhibition, sports and cultural activities for both physically challenged and physically non challenged persons. Thus Ashabory Welfare Society has been committed to improvement of the society and always ready to take any initiative for the betterment of the Society.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Vision: To see least people to be converted into modern social globalization. Goal: To establish self supported 500 families in each community for 5 years. Social Service and social action: we could achieved to reach out to the least people through social service and action. first of all, we used to conduct different kinds of seminar for giving awareness to them. finally, we assigned them to do for the well being within themselves. even we were distributing cloths, foods and digging well for drinking water from fountain water. and also making bamboo bridge for their transportation in remote areas. Education and SHG: we encourage all the young people to serve nation without any expectation - indeed, Many educated youths were dedicated their lives for the welfare of the poor students where we settled school. Health services: We have achieved beyond our expectation this program also. we have established anti-malaria campaign camp in most remote areas where tribal people are living. more than 7000 patients were saved yearly in several regions from malaria Pf and PV. Besides, we extended our hand for Aids, tuberculosis effected people. we used to help to the Government dispensaries special 6 districts in Tripura.

ngoList.title: cultural campaign
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Cultural Campaign a progresive cultural unit of khowai was founded on the 18th January 1980.In this thertytwo years of life of the organization, it has staged about 80 nos of Darama in total.It was founded with the motto to stage Drama and gradually expanded its brunches in nthe fild of Artand recitation and starts school for learning of Drawaing recitation among the childrens. In the fild of Drama the organization gradually hold a plase in the North-East region of the country. It has afame in the North-East region of the country and is famailier to the people of this part.Since 1981 the organization has been organizing a Drama commpittition namely Shekhar Memorial One Act Drama Competition  in the meomory of late Shekhar Bhattacharjee one of the founder member of the organization. At first it was started as state level and gradually it is converted into North-East regional. Teams from the states of the N.E. region take part in this competition and the teams from other states of the country and also from our neighbouring country Nepal and Bangladesh has participaited in this programe.In the year 2005 we celebrated The Silver Jubilee year of said competition with a great pomp. Cultural Campaign has make tour to West Bengal, Andhrapradesh,Assam and Our neighbouring country Bangladesh with the Drama Sada Payrar Jannya ,Debona Titun,  Abalamban, Aarek Long March &  Court Martial drama production of the organization staged sevarel time over there. Till today the number of production the organization is as follows :- Full length Drama - 20 nos. One- Act Drama -29 nos, Street Drama -07 nos, Dance Drama- 05 nos, Child Drama -19 nos. It is to be mantion here that among these 26 nos are Local scrept and the writers are Chandan Sengupta, Kamal Roy Choudhury, Sanjoy Kar, Dulal Oriya, Paresh Sutradhar, Ashim Roy, Indhumadhab Chokraborty, Ganesh Debroy & Arun Paul.Cultural Campaign had been organised Drama Work-shop in sevarel time at khowai. Mr. H. Kanhaia Lal(Manipur),Mr. Debesh Choudhury,Mr. Nikhil Das,Mr. Bijoy Bhattacharya(W.B), Mr. Bamapada Mukharjee,Dr.Jaladhar Mallik,Mr. Hirendra Shinha,Mr. Saruj Choudhury(Tripura) was present in the Work-shop as Trainer cum Teacher. Last year we organised a child Drama work shop with the help of The National School of Drama, Delhi.
